  • Help

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Cell
Abstract base class representing a cell on the game board.
CellCoordinates
Represents immutable coordinates of a cell on the game board.
Client
The Client class is responsible for connecting to the game server, initializing the main application window, and handling incoming messages.
ComputerPlayer
Represents a computer-controlled player in the game.
ComputerShootingManager
Handles shooting logic for the computer player.
DestroyMechanism
Implements logic for destroying a partially hit ship by the computer player.
Directions
Represents the four cardinal directions used in the game.
Game
Represents a game between two players.
GameEndDto
Data transfer object representing the end of a game.
HumanPlayer
Represents a human player in the game.
Layout
Represents the different layout states of the game UI.
Main
 
MainMenu
Displays the main menu of the Java Ship Game.
Map
Provides methods to generate and update the main game UI, including ship placement, shooting phases, scoreboard, and end game dialogs.
Map<T extends Cell>
Represents a generic square map containing cells of a specific type.
MapConfigfuration
Represents the configuration of the game map, including its size and ship layout.
Menu
Marker interface for menu components in the client application.
MessageHandler
Handles incoming messages and objects from the server, dispatching them to the appropriate UI update methods.
PauseMenu
Provides a modal pause menu dialog during gameplay.
PauseStartRequest
Request object sent by the client to indicate the start of a pause.
PauseStopRequest
Request object sent by the client to indicate the end of a pause.
Player
Represents a player in the game.
ReceiveShotDto
Data transfer object representing the result of a shot received by the player.
ScoreboardDto
Data transfer object representing the scoreboard.
ScoreboardHandler
Handles storing and retrieving player scores using binary serialization.
ScoreboardRequest
Request object sent by the client to retrieve the current scoreboard.
ScoreDto
Data transfer object representing a single player's score entry.
Server
 
ShipPlacementDto
Data transfer object representing a ship placement action.
ShipPlacementRequestDto
Data transfer object representing a request for ship placement.
ShipPlacingManager
Responsible for placing ships on the map based on user input.
ShipsCell
Represents a cell on the game board that may contain a ship.
ShipsConfiguration
Represents the configuration of ships used in the game.
ShipsMap
Represents a map used for tracking ship positions in the game.
ShootingCell
Represents a cell on the shooting map used to track shots and aiming status.
ShootingMap
Represents a shooting map used by a player to track their shots.
ShotStatus
Represents the result of a shot in the game, including its status and target coordinate.
ShotStatuses
Represents the possible outcomes of a shot in the game.
